Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2009 01:40PM janie-r wrote: So I'm reading all of these postings and wondering how long do I have to wait to get a foam prothesis.  Feel very self concious with just one breast - I know I have to wait according to the doctor until end of July for a prescription but do I have to wait that long for a foamy??  It's very hard to find button up shirts that don't show your one breast sticking out??  Any help would be appreciated.
Posts.Title: Nervouse about getting prosthesis for the first time BethHG nagem

Posts.Content: janie-r wrote: Hi all - Had Mastectomy of left side June 5.  Was told not to raise my arm above should level until last visit on June 26.  Arm is very stiff and sore tendon that goes from the armpit all the way down to the wrist.  I have a tendon that sticks out in the armpit and this was extremely sore until last week and it calmed down a bit.  Doctors nurse said they've never heard about cording and told me to work on my exercises to stretch this tendon out. How do I know if I have cording??  Will the stretching exercises help even though this arm is really stiff especially in the forearm?? There is no therapists in my area that know about massage to relieve this.  Also, am really freaked out about getting lymphedema.  Once I heal more I would like to help the husband out with the wood we burn every year.  Could hauling and stacking wood cause lymphedema.??  Will I ever be able to resume all the stuff I like to do outside??  Can y'all help me out??? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: CORDED OR NOT???? janie-r LindaLou53

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2009 02:20PM janie-r wrote: Binney and memer_of_the_club:  Thanks for your replies.  I will work my stretching slowly and hopefully what I think might be the beginning of cording will go away.  I checked further and it looks like there might be a couple of PT that had Lymphedema schooling so maybe they can help if I need it.  I'll be coming back to you folks with more questions I'm sure.  I'm just trying to work thru all of this and my emotions at this time.  I was never an extremely emotional person before but I seem to be much more now.  We'll all hang in there together.
Posts.Title: CORDED OR NOT???? janie-r LindaLou53

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2009 08:20AM janie-r wrote: I don't know what number we were on - but from my female boss who is 50 like me. "OMG - I'm so glad that I'm not you - I'M healthy."   I know she (probably) means well but ever since my mastectomy she has worn alot of lower cut tops to show off her boobs.  She just doesn't get it.  I told my husband that I know it's really really wrong to think this way - but I hope something happens to her so I can remind her about being healthy.  I'm trying to get rid of this way of thinking.
Posts.Title: 100 things never to say to a woman who has had a mastectomy: iwannabefree jillyG

Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2009 11:46AM janie-r wrote: I DID NOT CHOOSE TO HAVE ANY PLASTIC SURGERY - WILL HAVE PROTHESIS FITTING WHEN SURGEON SAYS I CAN- I GUESS END OF JULY - MY LEFT MASTECTOMY WAS JUNE 5.  CURIOUS AS TO WHAT I SHOULD ACTUALLY LOOK LIKE - IT IS NOT FLAT LIKE I THOUGHT IT WOULD BE.  I HAVE A HARD RIDGE UNDER THE INCISION THAT RUNS AROUND UNDERNEATH MY ARMPIT.  SURGEON SAYS IT WILL NOT GO AWAY TOTALLY - THAT I WILL ALWAYS HAVE LUMPS.  I THINK HE DIDN'T DO A GOOD JOB AND I MIGHT HAVE TO HAVE PLASTIC SURGERY TO ELIMINATE THESE FAT ROLLS OR WHATEVER THEY ARE.  HAD A 2 SENTINAL NODE REMOVAL - JUST THIS WEEK I DEVELOPED A TIGHTENED CORD IN MY ARMPIT WITH EXTREME TENDERNESS THAT GOES DOWN MY ARM.  IS THIS CORDING??  HAD NO CANCER IN THE NODES SO THAT IS A GOOD THING.  ANY ANSWERS ON HOW I SHOULD LOOK AFTER SURGERY WOULD HELP - THIS IS QUITE DEPRESSING.
Posts.Title: doctor's mistakes femme janie-r

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2009 08:52AM janie-r wrote: Thanks so much Kira.  I will look at these articles and bring them with me when I go the PT.  I did get to talk to the gal yesterday and she was familiar with cording.  When I told her who my surgeon was she told me that my oncologist would give me a referral to see her as my surgeons office would not.  Must be there are more women in my area that have had this problem and the doctor's office just "poo - poos" it as nothing. Thanks again and I will let you know how it goes.
Posts.Title: CORDED OR NOT???? janie-r LindaLou53

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2009 08:50AM janie-r wrote: Thanks to both of you for your information.  There are 2 PT's in my area that I found under the National Lymphedema Network.  I am going to talk to them to see if they have worked on cording issues.  In the meantime I will continue to do my stretches as see if I can work this out on my own.  I'm afraid to stretch to far as I don't want to tear anything.  Should I start massaging my incision area to break up scar tissue or wait for the surgeon to tell me when it's okay?
Posts.Title: CORDED OR NOT???? janie-r LindaLou53
